New Records: Shaedon Sharpe's 33 points for Portland were a career high.
Key Match Events: Minnesota shot 39.4 percent from the floor as a team and went 7-of-39 on three-pointers.
The Wolves were also out-rebounded 47-41 and allowed 52 points in the paint.
Shaedon Sharpe's 33 points for Portland were a career high.
Post-Match Reflections: Anthony Edwards placed the blame on himself and his teammates after the Wolves lost 106-98 to the Portland Trail Blazers.
Edwards mentioned that the team needs to mature and follow the coaches' guidance.
Rudy Gobert emphasized the need to play with the edge of a champion and took responsibility for the team's defensive performance.
Julius Randle and Rudy Gobert struck a similar tone with their postgame assessments.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Minnesota has slipped from first to ninth in defensive rating.
The team is 25th in rebounding average despite having Randle and Gobert to anchor the frontcourt.
Donte DiVincenzo is shooting just 30.6 percent from deep.
The Timberwolves can't afford to throw away games against lesser opponents such as Portland.
